newsitem.title: UK: Orange losses widen as customers rise.
newsitem.headline: Orange losses widen as customers rise.

text.p: Orange Plc, Britain's youngest mobile telephone operator, reported widening annual losses on Monday but said that its customer base now topped 850,000.

The company, whose shares have at last risen above their 205p flotation price last March as the group builds a reputation for innovation, said year pretax losses had widened to 229 million pounds ($367.2 million) from 141 million pounds.

Analysts, who do not expect the company to become profitable on a pretax level before 1999 because of the heavy investment needed to build out its network, had expected pretax losses of around 231.1 million stg.
Managing director Hans Snook said in the results statement that the company, whose market share has risen to 11.5 percent from seven percent, was 'ideally positioned for further growth'.
